subject: Fwd: Re: question
msgSnippet: Read Alphabet group members: A post received today got me thinking about items uploaded to the site.  Copyright law is strict.  That is why we must be
messageBody:
Read Alphabet group members:

A post received today got me thinking about items uploaded to the site.  Copyright law is strict.  That is why we must be careful with what is posted on Read Alphabet or uploaded in files.  A Pillow of Winds is under copyright.  It cannot be posted on our site.  Therefore, I must remove it and any other files which quote copyrighted material.

This is not intended to prevent anyone from posting items whether in Junior or Senior QS.  It is great to see people using QS and getting involved in promoting the alphabet.

Just make sure items you post are in the public domain, i.e. their copyrights have all expired.  Shakespeare's sonnets are fine.  Poetry or prose from the 19th century is fine.  At this point, anything you post should have been published prior to 1923 according to the U.S. Copyright Office to insure it is in the public domain.  Thanks for your understanding.

Paige Gabhart


On 5/6/2018 12:24 PM, Lei Sulin lwoj.sjuwklim@... [Read_Alphabet] wrote:
Hello!

A while back a member of this group pleaded for more examples of Senior Quikscript, so I wrote a page of Senior and replied to that thread, attaching a JPG of it.  The attachment worked OK, and a couple of the members liked it and asked for more......

But when I tried to make another reply, using the same method as before, the reply was saved but it lacked the attachment.  I tried again with another reply.......same result.

I asked the readership if they had any idea what was going on and got no response.

Instead, I uploaded two files to the Files area, and they seemed to be uploaded successfully.

I'd like to post more, since there seems to be an interest for it, but I'd like to do it in the proper way and, given the way it's behaving, I'm not sure what that way might be.  Can you please help me?

Thanks.

                       Dave S


Virus-free. www.avast.com
